basics.name: Jeffrey A. Levy
basics.label: PhD Economist
basics.summary: An applied economist focusing on macroeconomics, uncertainty, machine learning, and the intersection of social science and data science.

work.name: Harris School of Public Policy, University of Chicago
work.summary: Instructional faculty focusing on data and programming and machine learning, as well as instruction in Python and R. I also organize professional development workshops and events for students.

work.name: Urban Institute
work.summary: Member of Urban's research programming team, where I joined a variety of research centers to enable research that required advanced programming, machine learning, and technical skills.

professionalMemberships.summary: Active member participating in annual meetings and elections.
Voting member for the organization that maintains and grows the Python programming language.

references.name: Ryan Kellogg
references.reference: Deputy Dean for Academic Programs and Faculty Director, Harris School of Public Policy, University of Chicago. Contact: kelloggr@uchicago.edu

references.name: Xuguang Simon Sheng
references.reference: Economics Department Chair, American University. Co-author, and formerly my dissertation committee chair. Contact: sheng@american.edu

references.name: Gabriel Mathy
references.reference: Associate Professor, American University Department of Economics. Co-author, and formerly a member of my dissertation committee. Contact: mathy@american.edu

references.name: Jessica Kelly
references.reference: Senior Director, Research and Web Technology, Urban Institute. Formerly my supervisor as a data scientist. Contact: jkelly@urban.org
